claim: Tony Blair was elected after John Smith's sudden death.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Anthony Charles Lynton Blair  (  born 6 May 1953  )  is a British politician who served as Prime Minister of the United Kingdom from 1997 to 2007 and Leader of the Labour Party from 1994 to 2007 .

claim: Tony Blair was elected after John Smith's sudden death.
premise_source_doc_sentence: He remains the most recent Labour Party leader to have won a general election .

claim: Tony Blair was elected after John Smith's sudden death.
premise_source_doc_sentence: From 1983 to 2007 , Blair was the Member of Parliament  (  MP  )  for Sedgefield .

claim: Tony Blair was elected after John Smith's sudden death.
premise_source_doc_sentence: He was elected Labour Party leader in July 1994 , following the sudden death of his predecessor , John Smith , who together with his predecessor , Neil Kinnock , had started to move the party closer to the political centre , in the hope of winning power .

claim: Tony Blair was elected after John Smith's sudden death.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Under Blair 's leadership , the party used the phrase `` New Labour '' , to distance it from previous Labour policies and the traditional conception of socialism .

claim: Tony Blair was elected after John Smith's sudden death.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Blair declared support for a new conception that he referred to as `` social-ism '' , involving politics that recognised individuals as socially interdependent , and advocated social justice , cohesion , the equal worth of each citizen , and equal opportunity , also referred to as the Third Way .

claim: Tony Blair was elected after John Smith's sudden death.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Critics of Blair denounced him for having the Labour Party abandon genuine socialism and accepting capitalism .

claim: Tony Blair was elected after John Smith's sudden death.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Supporters , including the party 's public opinion pollster Philip Gould , stated that after four consecutive general election defeats , from 1979 to 1992 , the Labour Party had to demonstrate that it had made a decisive break from its left-wing past , in order to win an election again .

claim: Tony Blair was elected after John Smith's sudden death.
premise_source_doc_sentence: In May 1997 , the Labour Party won a landslide general election victory , the largest in its history , allowing Blair , at 43 years old , to become the youngest Prime Minister since 1812 .

claim: Tony Blair was elected after John Smith's sudden death.
premise_source_doc_sentence: In September 1997 , Blair attained early personal popularity , receiving a 93 % public approval rating , after his public response to the death of Princess Diana .

claim: Tony Blair was elected after John Smith's sudden death.
premise_source_doc_sentence: The Labour Party went on to win two more elections under his leadership : in 2001 , in which it won another landslide victory , and in 2005 , with a reduced majority .

claim: Tony Blair was elected after John Smith's sudden death.
premise_source_doc_sentence: In the first years of the New Labour government , Blair 's government introduced the National Minimum Wage Act , Human Rights Act , and Freedom of Information Act .

claim: Tony Blair was elected after John Smith's sudden death.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Blair 's government also devolved power , establishing the Scottish Parliament , the National Assembly for Wales , and the Northern Ireland Assembly .

claim: Tony Blair was elected after John Smith's sudden death.

claim: Tony Blair was elected after John Smith's sudden death.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Blair strongly supported the foreign policy of the Bush administration , and ensured that the British Armed Forces participated in the 2001 invasion of Afghanistan and , more controversially , the 2003 invasion of Iraq .

claim: Tony Blair was elected after John Smith's sudden death.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Blair has faced strong criticism for his role in the invasion of Iraq , including calls for having him tried for war crimes and waging a war of aggression .

premise_source_doc_sentence: Blair was succeeded as the leader of the Labour Party and as Prime Minister by Gordon Brown in June 2007 .

claim: Tony Blair was elected after John Smith's sudden death.
premise_source_doc_sentence: He was elected Labour Party leader in July 1994 , following the sudden death of his predecessor , John Smith , who together with his predecessor , Neil Kinnock , had started to move the party closer to the political centre , in the hope of winning power .

claim: Tony Blair was elected after John Smith's sudden death.
premise_source_doc_sentence: He had become leader of the party in July 1994 , two months after the sudden death of his predecessor John Smith , and rebranded it `` New Labour '' , in a move which was well received by voters and which saw the abandonment of many traditional socialist policies of the Labour Party , including the mass nationalisation of industry which had been pioneered by Clement Attlee half a century earlier and remained on the Labour manifesto until the mid 1990s , whereas the Conservative government of Margaret Thatcher had privatised most of the state-owned industries and utilities during the 1980s , and the process had continued on a lesser scale under her successor John Major since November 1990 .

claim: Tony Blair was elected after John Smith's sudden death.
premise_source_doc_sentence: A leadership election was held on 21 July 1994 for the Labour Party in the United Kingdom , after the sudden death of incumbent leader John Smith .

claim: Tony Blair was elected after John Smith's sudden death.
premise_source_doc_sentence: When John Smith died in 1994 , she became the first woman to lead the Labour Party , although Tony Blair won the election to replace Smith shortly afterwards to assume the substantive leadership .

claim: Tony Blair was elected after John Smith's sudden death.
